instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: Green Light No Post <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: MacBook Air board that shows some signs of serious humidity or light liquid damage. Has gone through Ultrasonic cleaning already. It seems to be missing all S3, S4, and S0 rails however the G3H and S5 rails all have correct voltages. Could this be a PM SLP issue

threads.title: Green Light No Post <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: PPBUS? 3V at L7560? Checked the usual suspects, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and termination resistors in data lines, PPVRTC. J6100 corrosion?
